oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE EFFECT OF THE CL-VORTEX FORCE IN 3D WAVE-CURRENT INTERACTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dingemans, M.W.
van Kester, J.A. Th.M.
Radder, A.C.
Uittenbogaard, R.E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CL vortex force
vortex force
wave/current interaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Experiments in flumes (i.e., Kemp and Simons, 1982, 1983, and Klopman, 1994) have shown that the mean current profile for following waves is more uniformly distributed than the corresponding current-only case, whereas the case of an opposing current leads to a more straight profile. This paper is concerned with proving that inclusion of the so-called Craik-Leibovich (CL) vortex force in the mean-current equation gives, at least for a part, an explanation of this phenomenon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
